headline: Why are bogus warnings appearing under tweets?
description:
Tweet in question: https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1313600611947028486

I'm curious as to why this tweet has a warning under it saying "Joe Biden did not introduce a man in blackface" despite the tweet content being totally irrelevant. This user seems to be testing twitter features and gaming the system intentionally since they have other tweets with irrelevant warnings attached ([1], [2]). Why are they able to do this?

[1] https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1313220807259312132 [2] https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1311404976527343618
headline_zh-Hans: 为什么推文下会出现假的警告？
headline_zh-Hant: 為什麼推文下會出現假的警告？
description_zh-Hans:
相关推特: https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1313600611947028486

我很好奇，为什么这条推特下面有一个警告，说"乔-拜登没有介绍一个穿黑脸的人"尽管推特内容完全不相关。这个用户似乎是在测试twitter的功能，并故意玩弄系统，因为他们还有其他附有不相关警告的推文（[1], [2]）。为什么他们能做到这一点？

[1] https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1313220807259312132 [2] https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1311404976527343618
description_zh-Hant:
相關推特: https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1313600611947028486

我很好奇，為什麼這條推特下面有一個警告，說"喬-拜登沒有介紹一個穿黑臉的人"儘管推特內容完全不相關。這個用戶似乎是在測試twitter的功能，並故意玩弄系統，因為他們還有其他附有不相關警告的推文（[1], [2]）。為什麼他們能做到這一點？

[1] https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1313220807259312132 [2] https://twitter.com/29notions/status/1311404976527343618
